attributes.action: That the Government set aside one day a year as Forces Day
attributes.background: The City of Nottingham have disbanded the Forces Day because of funding.  Once this has been  confirmed and carried out other councils will follow.   Forces day hels recruiting and understanding the forces way of life.

rejection.details:
National armed forces day will take place on Saturday 24 June 2017, so we are not sure what further action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take. 

Nottingham city council's involvement in national armed forces day is the responsibility of Nottingham city council, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Nottingham city council has its own petitions website. You can find out more about how to petition the city council here: 

http://committee.nottinghamcity.gov.uk/mgEPetitionListDisplay.aspx?bcr=1
